properties.title: Java date and time API - Download and Installation
properties.author: Al Major

section.name: Joda Time Distribution
section.p: Unless you have a specific reason to do otherwise, you should work with the pre-built joda-time distribution. Building the entire distribution from the CVS sources requires a maven installation, and is not (as yet) completely straightforward. Once the "joda-time.jar" is in your classpath, you will be able to use joda-time.

section.name: Eclipse Support
section.p: If you use Eclipse as your IDE and want to integrate the joda-time help files into the eclipse documentation tree, you need to download and install the joda-time documentation plugin.

In addition, if you are developing Eclipse plugins (i.e. using the PDE), you may choose to use the joda-time plugin. This is a wrapper around the joda-time jar which allows a single copy of the joda-time jar to be used by all installed plugins. It needs to be available on both the development and the run-time machine.

In addition you may also want the joda-time source plugin. This is a wrapper for the joda time sources to make them visible to the Eclipse PDE. It only needs to be made available on the development machine.
